articles.author: Angelo Amante, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders hold a final day of talks at their annual summit on Friday, with China topping the agenda before Pope Francis puts in a historic appearance to discuss artificial intelligence (AI).
articles.title: China to dominate final day of G7, Pope to lead AI discussions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican president-elect Claudia Sheinbaum's motorcade suffered an accident on Friday, her team said in a statement, leaving one person dead and several injured, though the car Sheinbaum was traveling in was not involved.
articles.title: Mexican president-elect's motorcade suffers accident, Sheinbaum fine

articles.author: Wendell Roelf, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South Africa's newly elected parliament convenes on Friday to choose the country's next president with the public still in the dark about which parties will join the African National Congress in government and the policies they will pursue.
articles.title: South Africa parliament convenes as talks on who will govern go down to the wire

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli jets and artillery hit targets in southern Lebanon on Friday after dozens of missiles were launched towards northern Israel, the military said as an escalation in cross-border strikes continued for a third day.
articles.title: Israeli jets strike targets in Lebanon after missile barrage hits northern areas

articles.author: Sabine Siebold
articles.description: NATO will assume a greater role in coordinating arms supplies to Ukraine, the alliance said on Friday, taking over from the United States in a bid to safeguard the process as NATO-sceptic Donald Trump bids for a second term as U.S. president.
articles.title: NATO to take greater role coordinating military aid for Kyiv, says Stoltenberg

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Washington will impose sanctions on an Israeli group on Friday for attacking humanitarian aid convoys bound for starving civilians in Gaza, U.S. officials told Reuters, in the latest move targeting actors Washington believes threaten the prospects for peace between Israelis and Palestinians.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to impose sanctions on Israeli group that attacked Gaza aid

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, has said she is making good progress as she undergoes preventative chemotherapy but is "not out of the woods" ahead of her first public appearance on Saturday since surgery revealed the presence of cancer.
articles.title: Britain's Kate says she is making good progress with cancer treatment, will attend event

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military is preparing to temporarily remove its humanitarian pier off the coast of Gaza because of anticipated sea conditions, a U.S. official said on Friday, the latest challenge to the effort that has been hampered by bad weather since it was put into place in May.
articles.title: US preparing to temporarily remove Gaza pier due to sea conditions, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia would cease fire and enter peace talks if Ukraine dropped its NATO ambitions and withdrew its forces from four Ukrainian regions claimed by Moscow.
articles.title: Putin says Russia will cease fire if Ukraine pulls troops from four regions

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: U.S. Catholic bishops offered an apology to Native Americans on Friday for the church's role in inflicting trauma on their communities and adopted new guidelines for ministering to indigenous Catholics.
articles.title: US Catholic bishops apologize to Native Americans for abuses, promise new outreach
